message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This research relies on data from the National Crime Victimization Survey and complementary data from the Uniform Crime Reporting Program.", "dataset": ["National Crime Victimization Survey", "Uniform Crime Reporting Program"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To analyze the impact of various interventions, we used data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey and also used longitudinal hospitalization dataset of Medicare patients.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey", "longitudinal hospitalization dataset of Medicare patients"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This report utilizes novel data from the Global Competitiveness Index in conjunction with publicly available trade statistics to quantify the relationship between competition policies and firm performance.", "dataset": ["Global Competitiveness Index"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Using survey data collected during the Ebola epidemic and rainfall data from satellite measurements, we investigate community perceptions and behaviors regarding malaria prevention.", "dataset": ["survey data collected during the Ebola epidemic"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We adopt a primarily empirical approach using datasets that pair responses to a nationally representative household health survey with an administrative claims dataset housed within the Ministry of Health's national health insurance program for Ghana (NHIS).", "dataset": ["nationally representative household health survey", "administrative claims dataset housed within the Ministry of Health's national health insurance program for Ghana (NHIS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This article leverages a unique dataset comprising millions of transactions from a large U.S. bank during the COVID-19 pandemic and combines it with survey data to understand the direct and indirect effects of the pandemic on consumers and banks.", "dataset": ["unique dataset comprising millions of transactions from a large U.S. bank", "survey data"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "Using satellite imagery and data from the Early Warning - Early Action tool, we were able to identify factors that drive food insecurity in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery", "Early Warning - Early Action tool"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "We exploit a novel dataset combining high-frequency diurnal weather patterns, crop performance indices at various stages of growth, household demographics, and detailed financial records of compensations, insurance payouts, and loan repayment data for farmers in Kenya.", "dataset": ["high-frequency diurnal weather patterns", "crop performance indices at various stages of growth", "household demographics", "detailed financial records of compensations, insurance payouts, and loan repayment data for farmers in Kenya"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses an innovative dataset combining direct observations of land cover change derived from satellite imagery with government administrative records and survey data to understand the drivers of deforestation in Indonesia.", "dataset": ["direct observations of land cover change derived from satellite imagery", "government administrative records", "survey data"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "To analyze the effect of transportation policies on health outcomes, we use data from the National Health Interview Survey in conjunction with publicly available transportation data from the Bureau of Transportation Statistics.", "dataset": ["National Health Interview Survey", "publicly available transportation data from the Bureau of Transportation Statistics"], "topic": ["Transport", "Health"]}]
